description: TO ELECT A SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE FOR THE 61ST CONGRESS. VOTES FOR J.G. CANNON, REPUBLICAN, ARE CODED 2. VOTES FOR C. CLARK DEMOCRAT ARE CODED 1.
Issue1: Election of the Speaker of the House

description: TO MOVE THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON ADOPTING RESOLUTION PROVIDING THAT THE RULES OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES FOR THE 60TH CONGRESS BE ADOPTED FOR THE H OF R OF THE 61ST CONGRESS, INCLUDING STANDING ORDER OF DEC. 2, 1902 RELATING TO PENSION AND CLAIM BILLS.  (P. 19-2)

TO ADOPT RESOLUTION THAT THE RULES OF THE H OF R OF THE 60TH CONGRESS BE ADOPTED AS THE RULES OF THE 61ST CONGRESS INCLUDING STANDING ORDERS OF DEC. 2, 1902, RELATING TO THE CONSIDERATION OF PENSION AND CLAIM BILLS.  (P. 19-2)

TO MOVE THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 11 TO ADOPT THE RULES OF THE H OF R OF THE 60TH CONGRESS FOR THE 61ST CONGRESS, 1ST AND EXTRA SESSIONS ONLY, WITH AMENDMENTS AUTHORIZING THE SPEAKER TO APPOINT A STANDING COMMITTEE NAMED, AND NO OTHER UNLESS AUTHORIZED, AND PROVIDING THAT SECTION 1 OF RULE 10 RELATING TO COMMITTEE ON RULES BE AMEN- DED "ON RULES, TO CONSIST OF 15 MEMBERS OF THE HOUSE ELECTED BY HOUSE, SAID COMMITTEE TO ELECT ITS OWN CHAIRMAN, "WHO ARE AUTHORIZED TO REVISE, AMEND, SIMPLIFY RULES OF PROCEDURE.

TO AMEND H. RES. 11 MAKING THE RULES OF THE H OF R OF THE 60TH CONGRESS THE RULES OF THE H OF R OF THE 61ST CONGRESS, BY ELIMINATING ALL AFTER ENACTING CLAUSE, AND SUBSTITUTE LANGUAGE PROVIDING THAT THE RULES OF THE H OF R OF THE 60TH CONGRESS BE THE RULES OF THE 61ST CONGRESS, INCLUDING SPE- CIAL ORDERS RELATING TO CONSIDERATION OF PENSION AND CLAIM BILLS ON FRIDAYS, AND PROVIDING ALSO TO MODIFY RULES, SO AS TO PERMIT ANY MEMBER TO FILE A NOTICE WITH THE CLERK AND HAVE A BILL, WHICH HAS BEEN ON THE HOUSE OR UNION CALENDAR FOR 3 DAYS, PLACED ON SPECIAL CALENDAR FOR UNANIMOUS CON- SENT, AND TO PROVIDE THAT AFTER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION HAS BEEN ORDERED, ONE MOTION TO RECOMMIT SHALL BE IN ORDER, PRIORITY GIVEN TO ONE MEMBER OPPOSED TO BILL; TO REQUIRE A TWO-THIRDS VOTE TO SET ASIDE CALENDAR WEDNESDAY.  (P. 23-2)

TO MOVE THE PREVIOUS QUESTION WHICH IS THE ADOPTION OF H. RES. 53, PROVIDING FOR CLOSE OF DEBATE ON TARIFF BILL H.R. 1438, AND THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO A COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON THE STATE OF THE UNION FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF SAID BILL FOR AMENDMENTS UNDER THE FIRST FIVE MINUTE RULE.

TO ADOPT RESOLUTION H. RES. 53, PROVIDING FOR CLOSE OF DEBATE ON TARIFF BILL H.R. 1438, AND THAT THE HOUSE RESOLVE ITSELF INTO A COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE ON THE STATE OF THE UNION FOR THE CONSIDERATION OF SAID BILL UNDER THE FIVE MINUTE RULE.  (P. 1112-2)
TO ADJOURN THE HOUSE UNTIL 12 NOON THE NEXT DAY, MADE DURING DEBATE ON THE TARIFF BILL, H.R.1438.  (P. 1120)

TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL H.R. 1438, BY STRIKING OUT PARAGRAPH 196 WHICH PLACES A DUTY OF ONE-HALF OF 1 CENT PER CUBIC FOOT ON TIMBER, HEWN, SIDED, OR SQUARED OTHERWISE THAN BY SAWING (NOT LESS THAN 8 INCHES SQUARE) AND ROUND TIMBER USED FOR SPARS OR BUILDING WHARVES.  (P. 1293-1)

TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL H.R. 1438, BY PLACING ON LUMBER OF ANY SORT PLANED OR FINISHED, A LEVY OF 50 CENTS PER THOUSAND FEET BOARD MEASURE, IF SO PLANED OR FINISHED FOR EACH SIDE DONE, AND IF PLANED ON ONE SIDE AND TONGUED AND GROOVED $1.00 PER THOUSAND FEET BOARD MEASURE, AND IF PLANED ON TWO SIDES AND TONGUED AND GROOVED, $1.50 PER THOUSAND BOARD MEASURE, NO DEDUCTION TO BE MADE ON BOARD MEASURE ON ACCOUNT OF PLANING, TONGUING AND GROOVING.  (P. 1293-2)
TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL H.R. 1438, BY PLACING ON THE FREE OF DUTY LIST, LUMBER FROM NORTH, CENTRAL AND SOUTH AMERICA OR ANY ISLAND OF THE WESTERN HEMISPHERE.  (P. 1294)
TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL, H.R. 1438, BY STRIKING OUT PARAGRAPH 197, WHICH WOULD PLACE LUMBER ON THE FREE LIST. (P. 1139 1295)

TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL, H.R. 1438, BY PLACING ON THE FREE LIST, WOOD; SAWED BOARDS, PLANKS, DEALS AND OTHER LUMBER OF WHITE WOOD, SYCAMORE AND BASS WOOD AND SAWED LUMBER, TIMBER HEWN, SIDED SQUARED OR SAWED AND ROUND TIMBER USED FOR SPARS OR IN BUILDING WHARVES, LOGS AND ROUND MANUFACTURED TIMBER, INCLUDING PULPWOODS, FIREWOODS, HANDLE BOLTS, SHINGLE BOLTS, GUN BLOCKS FOR GUNSTOCKS ROUGH HEWN OR SAWED OR PLANED ON ONE SIDE, HOP POLES, SHIP TIMBER, AND SHIP PLANKING, ALL THE FOREGOING NOT PROVIDED FOR IN SECTION 1 AND 2 OF THIS ACT.  (P. 1295-2)
TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL, H.R. 1438, BY PLACING A DUTY OF 24 CENTS PER BUSHEL ON BARLEY OF 48 POUNDS, AND ON BARLEY MALT, 40 CENTS PER BUSHEL OF 34 POUNDS. (P. 1273-2, 1275-1, 1296-2)
TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL, H.R. 1438, BY IMPOSING A 10% ADVALOREM DUTY ON HIDES WEIGHING ONE (1) LB. OR OVER. (P. 1142-1, 1297-1)
TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL, H.R. 1438, BY PLACING A DUTY OF 10 PER CENT AD VALOREM ON HIDES OF CATTLE, RAW OR UNCURED, WHETHER DRIED, SALTED OR PICKLED.  (P. 1297-2)
TO AMEND THE TARIFF BILL, H.R 1438, BY PLACING PETROLEUM, CRUDE OR REFINED, ON THE FREE LIST.  (P. 129921)

TO RECOMMIT TO THE COMMITTEE ON WAYS AND MEANS THE BILL H.R. 1438, WITH INSTRUCTIONS TO AMEND IT AND REPORT BACK A BILL REDUCING THE DUTIES CARRIED BY THE BILL TO REVENUE RATES ONLY, SO AS TO RAISE THE MAXIMUM OF REVENUE WITH THE MINIMUM OF TAXATION.  (P. 1300-2)
ON PASSAGE OF THE BILL CREATING A TARIFF, H.R. 1438.
TO PASS H.J. RES. 45 (36 STAT 182, 4/23/1909) MAKING APPROPRIATIONS FOR CERTAIN EXPENSES OF THE 1ST SESSION OF THE 61ST CONGRESS.

ON PASSAGE OF THE CENSUS APPROPRIATION BILL, H.R. 10933, (36 STAT 1, 6/29/1909).  (P. 3773-2)

TO ORDER THE PREVIOUS QUESTION ON H. RES. 89, PROVIDING THAT THE HOUSE DISAGREE TO THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO H.R. 1438, (THE TARIFF BILL) AND AGREE TO THE REQUEST OF THE SENATE FOR A CONFERENCE ON SAID BILL.  (P. 4384-1)

ON ADOPTION OF H. RES. 89, PROVIDING THAT THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES TAKE FROM THE SPEAKERS TABLE, H.R. BILL 143, AND THAT THEY NONCONCUR IN GROSS IN THE SENATE AMENDMENTS TO SAME AND AGREE TO THE CONFERENCE ASKED BY THE SENATE AND A COMMITTEE OF CONFERENCE BE APPOINTED AT ONCE.

TO TABLE AN APPEAL TO S.J. RES. 40 (36 STAT 184), PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION OF THE U.S., AUTHORIZING CONGRESS TO LAY AND COLLECT TAXES ON INCOMES, FROM WHATEVER SOURCE DERIVED, WITHOUT APPORTIONMENT AMONG THE SEVERAL STATE'S AND WITHOUT REGARD TO ANY CENSUS OR ENUMERATION. THE CHAIR'S DECISION WAS, THAT THE AMENDMENT OFFERED BY REP. HENRY OF TEXAS WAS NOT IN ORDER, SAID AMENDMENT PROVIDING THAT 3/4 OF THE STATE'S CONVENTIONS CONCUR IN THE AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION, IN LIEU OF 3/4 OF THE STATE LEGISLATURES, AS IN THE ORIGINAL.

ON ADOPTION OF S.J. RES. 40 (36 STAT 184), PROPOSING AN AMENDMENT TO THE CONSTITUTION OF THE U.S., WHICH EMPOWERS CONGRESS TO LAY AND COLLECT TAXES ON INCOMES FROM WHATEVER SOURCE DERIVED WITHOUT APPORTIONMENT AMONG THE SEVERAL STATES, AND WITHOUT REGARD TO ANY CENSUS OR ENUMERATION, AFTER RATIFIED BY 3/4 OF THE SEVERAL STATES. (P. 4390-1, 4440)

TO TAKE UP S.C. RES. 5 FROM THE SPEAKER'S TABLE AND REFER TO THE COMMITTEE OF THE WHOLE HOUSE ON THE STATE OF THE UNION; THE RESOLUTION PROVIDING "THAT THE INVITATION EXTENDED AND PRESENTED TO THE VICE PRESIDENT AND SPEAKER OF THE H OF R AND THE CONGRESS OF THE U.S. BY THE ALASKA-YUKON-PACIFIC EXPOSITION, TO BE HELD AT SEATTLE, WASH. JUNE 1 TO OCT. 15, 1909, BE ACCEPTED AND THAT PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE AND SPEAKER OF THE HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES APPOINT A COMMITTEE TO CONSIST OF 10 SENATORS AND 15 REPRESENTATIVES OF THE 61ST U.S. CONGRESS TO ATTEND SAME, AND THAT AN APPROPRIATION BE MADE TO MEET THE EXPENSES OF THOSE ATTENDING.
